questions.question: The specific charge of cathode rays

answers.b: Depends on the nature of the gas in the tube
answers.d: Depends on the metal used for cathode

explanations.a: The specific charge does not depend on applied voltage.
explanations.b: Cathode rays are the same regardless of the gas.
explanations.c: Correct. Specific charge (e/m) of cathode rays is constant.
explanations.d: The cathode material does not affect the specific charge.

explanations.a: Neutrons have no charge, unlike cathode rays.
explanations.b: Protons move in the opposite direction in electric fields.
explanations.c: Correct. Cathode rays consist of electrons.
explanations.d: They are particles, not EM waves.
